Physiological/Pathological: Primarily healthy hiPSC lines; can model disease if using patient-specific iPSC (e.g. DCM, HCM).
Cell Source: hiPSC-derived cardiomyocytes on a collagen/laminin nanofiber patch.
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Not inherently, can be combined with other patches in a microfluidic circuit.
Notable Features: Spontaneously beating syncytium, MEA-compatible, used in SARS-CoV-2 spike protein cardiotoxicity study.
Plate/Format (Throughput): Low–medium (each patch is a discrete unit).
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes (enzymatic dissociation) or direct lysis for RNA/protein.
Perfused: Optional. Patch can be static or microfluidic perfusion.
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Via flow controller if used, or manual media changes.

Physiological/Pathological: Healthy hiPSC lines; disease lines possible (e.g. Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s).
Cell Source: hiPSC-derived neurons & astrocytes on the same nanofiber patch.
Stromal Cells: Glial support cells included. No fibroblasts typically.
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Not inherent, can link multiple patches if desired.
3D Scaffold: Thin patch with 2D/3D network; partial hemisphere organoid possible.
Notable Features: Spontaneous electrical firing, astrocyte–neuron interactions, MEA-friendly.
Perfused: Optional. Static or microfluidic. Perfusion beneficial for long-term viability.
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes if flow is used; otherwise manual changes.

Physiological/Pathological: N/A. Equipment only, can support any model the user sets up.
Cell Source: N/A. The controller is cell-agnostic. Users combine it with patches.
Multiple Cell Types: Depends on patch(es). Possibly multi-organ if multiple patches are linked.
Circulating Immune: Possible if user flows immune cells in the circuit.
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): Yes, multiple patches can be connected in a single perfusion loop.
Air-Liquid Interface: Yes if top side is left open for lung/skin patches. The hardware can clamp them in place.
Extracellular Matrix: N/A. The hardware is not a substrate.
3D Scaffold: N/A. It's just a flow system for the patches.
Notable Features: Programmable flow rates, modular chip holders. Automates medium exchange.
Plate/Format (Throughput): Low–medium. Typically handles 1–4 patch modules in parallel.
Max Culture Duration: Days–weeks, if the system is sterile and stable.
Readouts - Live Imaging: Possible if the chip is transparent. The hardware does not do imaging by itself.
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Depends on the patch design. The hardware just provides fluidic control.
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes, can remove patch after culture.
Readouts - TEER: No direct measurement. Could be integrated if the patch supports it.
Readouts - MEA: No. Not integrated. External MEA possible for patches.
Dead Volume: Low, design aims for minimal tubing volume.
Perfused: Yes, main function of the Flow Controller.
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes (flow changes, media switching). Possibly software-based scheduling.
